member.name: T:NuGet.Protocol.Core.Types.INuGetResource
member.summary: Represents a resource provided by a server endpoint (V2 or V3).

member.name: T:NuGet.Protocol.Core.Types.INuGetResourceProvider
member.summary: INuGetResourceProviders are imported by SourceRepository. They exist as singletons which span all sources, and are responsible for determining if they should be used for the given source when TryCreate is called. The provider determines the caching. Resources may be cached per source, but they are normally created new each time to allow for caching within the context they were created in. Providers may retrieve other resources from the source repository and pass them to the resources they create in order to build on them.

member.name: M:NuGet.Protocol.Core.Types.INuGetResourceProvider.TryCreate(NuGet.Protocol.Core.Types.SourceRepository,System.Threading.CancellationToken)
member.summary: Attempts to create a resource for this source.
member.remarks: The provider may return true but null for the resource if the provider determines that it should not exist.
member.returns: True if this provider handles the input source.

member.name: P:NuGet.Protocol.Core.Types.INuGetResourceProvider.ResourceType
member.summary: Resource type provided

member.name: P:NuGet.Protocol.Core.Types.INuGetResourceProvider.Name
member.summary: Name of the provider. This is used for ordering.

member.name: P:NuGet.Protocol.Core.Types.INuGetResourceProvider.Before
member.summary: Names of providers this should be ordered BEFORE Gives this instance a higher priority.
member.remarks: If provider: default is named here, this provider will be called BEFORE default

member.name: P:NuGet.Protocol.Core.Types.INuGetResourceProvider.After
member.summary: Names of providers this should be ordered AFTER. Gives this instance a lower priority.
member.remarks: If provider: default is named here, this provider will be called AFTER default

member.name: P:NuGet.Protocol.Core.Types.VersionInfo.PackageSearchMetadata
member.summary: In V2, when finding the list of versions that a package ID has, we also get all of the metadata associated with each version. It would be wasteful to throw this away, so we store what we have here. For V3, the metadata property is null. Callers that receive this type need to be able to fetch this package metadata some other way if this property is null.
